return {

categoryId: breadcrumb.categoryId,

displayName: breadcrumb.text,

url: breadcrumb.url

};

});

}

}

output</h4><p class="body-copy">PS5 consoles support an 8K output, so you can play games on your 4320p resolution display.</p></div><div class="list-row"><h4 class="feature-title body-copy v-fw-medium">4K TV gaming</h4><p class="body-copy">Play your favorite PS5 games on your stunning 4K TV.</p></div><div class="list-row"><h4 class="feature-title body-copy v-fw-medium">Up to 120 fps with 120Hz output</h4><p class="body-copy">Enjoy smooth and fluid high frame rate gameplay at up to 120 fps for compatible games, with support for 120Hz output on 4K displays.</p></div><div class="list-row"><h4 class="feature-title body-copy v-fw-medium">Tempest 3D AudioTech</h4><p class="body-copy">Immerse yourself in soundscapes where it feels as if the sound comes from every direction. Through your headphones or TV speakers, your surroundings truly come alive with Tempest 3D AudioTech in supported games.</p></div><div class="list-row"><h4 class="feature-title body-copy v-fw-medium">Haptic feedback</h4><p class="body-copy">Experience a haptic feedback via the DualSense wireless controller in select PS5 titles, and feel the effects and impact of your in-game actions through the dynamic sensory feedback.</p></div><div class="list-row"><h4 class="feature-title body-copy v-fw-medium">Adaptive triggers</h4><p class="body-copy">Get to grips with immersive adaptive triggers, featuring dynamic resistance levels which simulate the physical impact of in-game activities in select PS5 games.</p></div></div></div></div></div></div><script v-border-bottom body-copy-lg v-fw-medium">Customer images</h3></div><div class="reviews-sort-search-filters row"><div class="col-xs-12"><div class="v-p-top-m row"><div class="d-none d-md-block class="reviews-search-bar col-xs-12 col-md-8 col-lg-9 v-m-bottom-xs"><h3 class="search-heading body-copy v-fw-medium v-m-bottom-xs d-md-none d-lg-none">Search</h3><form class="ugc-search class="bars-group"><div class="sr-only">5 out of 5</div><div class="rating-bar filled first"> </div><div class="rating-bar filled"> </div><div class="rating-bar filled"> </div><div class="rating-bar 5</div><div class="rating-bar filled first"> </div><div class="rating-bar filled"> </div><div class="rating-bar filled"> </div><div class="rating-bar filled"> </div><div class="rating-bar filled last"> </div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div class="review-item-content col-xs-12 col-md-8 col-lg-9"><div class="d-block d-md-none"><span class="c-overlay-wrapper"><span class="overlayTrigger"><button aria-controls="7319c40f-9f3b-3667-9f2d-693c0c35b0d0" aria-expanded="false" class="c-button-link author-button" data-track="Nickname Stats" type="button"><div class="ugc-author v-fw-medium body-copy-lg"><strong>Ina100years</strong></div></button></span></span></div><div class="verified-purchaser-sv-wrapper"><span class="c-overlay-wrapper"><span class="overlayTrigger"><button aria-controls="verified-purchase-badge-overlay" aria-expanded="false" class="c-button-link ugc-components verified-purchaser-badge" data-track="Verified Purchase Badge" type="button"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="svg-size-s v-m-right-xxs" role="img" viewbox="0 0 100 100"></svg>Verified Purchase</button></span></span></div><div class="network-badge-sv-mv-wrapper"></div><div class="review-heading"><div class="review-rating"><div class="c-ratings-reviews-v4 c-ratings-reviews-v4-size-small"><p class="sr-only">Rated 5 out of 5 stars</p><i aria-hidden="true" class="c-stars-wrapper c-stars-wrapper-size-eds-small"><span class="c-stars-container"><svg aria-hidden="true" fill="#C5CBD5" preserveaspectratio="xMinYMax slice" role="img" viewbox="0 0 120 24"></svg></span><span class="c-stars-container" style="width:85px"><svg aria-hidden="true" fill="#C28400" preserveaspectratio="xMinYMax slice" role="img" viewbox="0 0 120 24"></svg></span><span class="c-stars-container" style="width:85px"><svg aria-hidden="true" fill="#FFE000" preserveaspectratio="xMinYMax slice" role="img" viewbox="0 0 120 24"></svg></span></i></div></div><h4 class="c-section-title review-title heading-5 v-fw-medium" id="review-id-7319c40f-9f3b-3667-9f2d-693c0c35b0d0">The next gen console we've all been awaiting...</h4></div><div class="review-context v-p-top-xxs"><div class="verified-purchaser-mv-wrapper"><span class="c-overlay-wrapper"><span class="overlayTrigger"><button aria-controls="verified-purchase-badge-overlay" aria-expanded="false" class="c-button-link ugc-components verified-purchaser-badge" data-track="Verified Purchase Badge" type="button"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="svg-size-s v-m-right-xxs" role="img" viewbox="0 0 100 100"></svg>Verified Purchase</button></span></span><span class="vertical-align-bottom v-p-horizontal-xxs">|</span></div><div class="disclaimer v-m-right-xxs">Posted <time class="submission-date" title="Nov 25, 2020 11:18 PM">10 months ago</time>.</div><div class="length-of-ownership">Owned for <!-- -->2 weeks<!-- --> when reviewed.</div></div><div class="ugc-review-body body-copy-lg"><p class="pre-white-space">It was quite difficult to pre-order the PS5, but I truly lucked out because even with all the restocks certain retailers have had... it is still unbelievably hard to place the order. I hope anyone that still wants one gets one soon because it really is unfair that the gamers aren't able to land one whilst scalpers have thousands.


The PS5 has run beautifully and so intelligently from what I've experienced. The set up was of course easy and fast. The new UI is smooth and I definitely like it more than the old one on the PS4. 


The Dualsense Controller is AMAZING. It is probably the next best thing (only second to the console itself) with the way it works. It's not as slippery like the Dualshock and feels great in hand. Even after hours of gaming, I did not feel any fatigue in my hands. The battery life is probably similar to its predecessor. 


Overall, the console runs very smoothly and I have not experienced any sort of loudness with it. I do recommend when playing games, to choose performance over the resolution. You will absolutely get a higher FPS and I think it just runs a lot better that way. 


Would highly recommend this to anyone that wants to experience next gen even though we've just merely begun to play those games.</p></div><div class="in-review"><div class="feature-ratings"><h4 class="features-heading">Features</h4><div class="rating-bars"><div class="Value-rating rating-group"><div class="rating-description">Value</div><div class="bars-group"><div class="sr-only">5 out of 5</div><div class="rating-bar filled first"> </div><div class="rating-bar filled"> </div><div class="rating-bar filled"> </div><div class="rating-bar filled"> </div><div class="rating-bar filled last"> </div></div></div><div class="EaseofUse-rating rating-group"><div class="rating-description">Ease of Use</div><div class="bars-group"><div class="sr-only">5 out of 5</div><div class="rating-bar filled first"> </div><div class="rating-bar filled"> </div><div class="rating-bar filled"> </div><div class="rating-bar filled"> </div><div class="rating-bar filled last"> </div></div></div><div class="Quality-rating rating-group"><div class="rating-description">Quality</div><div class="bars-group"><div class="sr-only">5 out of 5</div><div class="rating-bar filled first"> </div><div class="rating-bar filled"> </div><div class="rating-bar filled"> </div><div class="rating-bar filled"> </div><div class="rating-bar filled last"> </div></div></div></div></div></div><ul class="carousel gallery-preview"><li><button class="c-button-unstyled ugc-components image-thumbnail-wrapper image-thumbnail-large" data-track="Image Gallery: Images in this review" type="button"><img aria-hidden="true" class="svg-size-s is-recommended-icon" fill="#318000" role="img" viewbox="0 0 100 100"></svg> I would<!-- --> recommend this to a friend</div><div class="row class="rating-bar filled"> </div><div class="rating-bar filled"> </div><div class="rating-bar filled last"> </div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div class="review-item-content col-xs-12 col-md-8 col-lg-9"><div class="d-block d-md-none"><span class="c-overlay-wrapper"><span class="overlayTrigger"><button aria-controls="30827832-8808-311a-89c3-72fdbcda3ad2" aria-expanded="false" class="c-button-link author-button" data-track="Nickname Stats" type="button"><div class="ugc-author v-fw-medium body-copy-lg"><strong>Tdox</strong></div></button></span></span></div><div class="verified-purchaser-sv-wrapper"><span class="c-overlay-wrapper"><span class="overlayTrigger"><button aria-controls="verified-purchase-badge-overlay" aria-expanded="false" class="c-button-link ugc-components verified-purchaser-badge" data-track="Verified Purchase Badge" type="button"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="svg-size-s v-m-right-xxs" role="img" viewbox="0 0 100 100"></svg>Verified Purchase</button></span></span></div><div class="network-badge-sv-mv-wrapper"></div><div class="review-heading"><div class="review-rating"><div class="c-ratings-reviews-v4 c-ratings-reviews-v4-size-small"><p class="sr-only">Rated 5 out of 5 stars</p><i aria-hidden="true" class="c-stars-wrapper c-stars-wrapper-size-eds-small"><span class="c-stars-container"><svg aria-hidden="true" fill="#C5CBD5" preserveaspectratio="xMinYMax slice" role="img" viewbox="0 0 120 24"></svg></span><span class="c-stars-container" style="width:85px"><svg aria-hidden="true" fill="#C28400" preserveaspectratio="xMinYMax slice" role="img" viewbox="0 0 120 24"></svg></span><span class="c-stars-container" style="width:85px"><svg aria-hidden="true" fill="#FFE000" preserveaspectratio="xMinYMax slice" role="img" viewbox="0 0 120 24"></svg></span></i></div></div><h4 class="c-section-title review-title heading-5 v-fw-medium" id="review-id-30827832-8808-311a-89c3-72fdbcda3ad2">happy days</h4></div><div class="review-context v-p-top-xxs"><div class="verified-purchaser-mv-wrapper"><span class="c-overlay-wrapper"><span class="overlayTrigger"><button aria-controls="verified-purchase-badge-overlay" aria-expanded="false" class="c-button-link ugc-components verified-purchaser-badge" data-track="Verified Purchase Badge" type="button"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="svg-size-s v-m-right-xxs" role="img" viewbox="0 0 100 100"></svg>Verified Purchase</button></span></span><span class="vertical-align-bottom v-p-horizontal-xxs">|</span></div><div class="disclaimer v-m-right-xxs">Posted <time class="submission-date" title="Apr 30, 2021 4:07 PM">4 months ago</time>.</div><div class="length-of-ownership">Owned for <!-- -->2 months<!-- --> when reviewed.</div></div><div class="ugc-review-body body-copy-lg"><p class="pre-white-space">Going over hardware and software. Not going over the every exact technical specs as you can easily look that up. Software can change overtime, this is review of software at launch. If any hardware hiccups or failures in near future I'll update this review


--Hardware:


Physical:

Looks futuristic yet tacky. In my personal opinion, looks doesn't really matter as long it can play next gen games well


Large console. Standing up it's the tallest home video console.


A lot of air-vents throughout making it aerodynamic, cool, quiet, and does not overheat or get hot with consecutive gameplay hours. This may change in the future if games require more performance out of the system, with similar fate like the PS4 where it was whisper quiet in beginning and became louder over the years with more graphical intensive games.


Has LED lights giving it a PC look (?)


Face plate easy to take out for future customization options (?).


667of 820gb of free download space in console


Swapping SDD is not as easy as Xbox Series X (with it's plug and play method) as you have to remove some screws. Upside is that it's standard and not a propriety SDD.


PS5 is compatible with most PS4 games. If you have an external SDD from PS4 it's just plug and transfer to PS5 internal storage


Comes with stand. Console is not entirely flat, so stand is required for horizontal position. You have console in vertical position without stand, but does not have grip (rubber feet) so may slide if bumped into or during an earthquake


Front of console: USB-C, USB-A, power, and eject button


Back of console: Two USB-A (Super Speed), LAN port, HDMI, and power port


Wished it had more USB-C ports to be future proof, but guess they kept USB-A for some current accessories to be backwards compatible. Disappointed the PS5 official 3D pulse headset and camera uses USB-A. Also no optical audio port means i can't use some of my surround sound headsets.


Load times for PS5 games are instantaneous. Ps4 games will load much faster, even without optimized patch.


Ps5 have ray tracing giving games realistic lighting effects


-Controller:


Console comes with one controller


Physically larger than past DuelShock controllers. Great for those with adult sized hands


Great tech demo included with 'Astro's Playroom'.


Haptic feedback. Similar to Nintendo Switch HD rumble, but more apparent. Not sure if developers will implement in future their games. Even with Nintendo first party; only '1-2 Switch' and 'Mario Party' from what I recall used HD rumble at great extent and it dropped off after that.


Adaptive triggers. Will feel resistance/push back on triggers if developers implement it in game.


Hope both Haptic feedback and Adaptive triggers say the entire lifespan and transfer to PS6 instead of dropping off like the six axis on PS3 and light bar in PS4


Has built in mic. Sound quality is similar to current smart phone on speaker. Has mute button


Similar to PS4, it has speaker and touch pad. Touch pad is more sensitive this time around


About double battery life of Ps4 controller. Able to get in 10 consecutive hours


Wished it came with back paddle buttons. Hopefully they release a DualSense Back Button Attachment like they did the DualShock 4


You can play PS4 games with DualShock 4 or DualSense . PS5 games only can be played with DualSense


--Software


UI, OS is the similar to PS4 with scrolling apps/games (left, right, up, down)


There's an activity row where you can track your progress on games


Other rows are News and PSN store


There are notifications popups, but you can turn on 'Do Not Disturb' mode


Similar to phone's swipe down tool bar for basic profile (trophy list, avatar, user info,etc), accessibility options, sound, Game Base, internet wifi select, controllers (see connected controllers), etc on home screen for easy access.


'Game Base' section is where you make party with friends and chat with them, view friend requests.


Share button this time around will pull up menu to take snap shot, record video, or save video previously played game session for up to 60mins


There's an 'Your Accolades' feature where you give props to other players. Reminds me of how to give endorsements (Sportsmanship, Good Teammate, Shot Caller) in Overwatch to encourage positivity in online community. For PS5 has Helpful, Welcoming, and Good Sport


There are accessibility options/preferences you can setup that transfers to your games


There's a 'Switcher' option where you can change games on the fly, but unlike the Xbox Series X's 'quick resume' does not leave where you left off, and will boot you back to the home screen of that game


Picture-in-picture mode if you want friends to help show you how to get through levels


PS4 games load faster on PS5 if downloaded to SSD. Graphical upgrade depends on publisher if they implement a 'PS5 upgrade" patch


-For PS5 trophies.


Trophies that have collectables there is a progress bar showing how much left to collect.


There are also tutorial videos for some games that implement it.


Some trophies once selected will drop you into the level/section where you can obtain the trophy. Again depends on game developer if they implement it.


PS4 trophies on PS5 act the same


Base price for games are $70 ($10 more than last gen); Excluding Special/Collector's editions, DLC, micro-transactions, loot crates, and surprise mechanics


Overall, aside from some odd design choices very capable next gen system. There are some features especially on the controller that developers have to utilize and may not be present in all games. If anything like the PS3 and PS4, going to have thousands of gameplay hours on this system</p></div><div class="in-review"><div class="feature-ratings"><h4 class="features-heading">Features</h4><div class="rating-bars"><div class="Quality-rating rating-group"><div class="rating-description">Quality</div><div class="bars-group"><div class="sr-only">5 out of 5</div><div class="rating-bar filled days","author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Tdox"},"reviewBody":"Going over hardware and software. Not going over the every exact technical specs as you can easily look that up. Software can change overtime, this is review of software at launch. If any hardware hiccups or failures in near future I'll update this review\n\n--Hardware:\n\nPhysical:\nLooks futuristic yet tacky. In my personal opinion, looks doesn't really matter as long it can play next gen games well\n\nLarge console. Standing up it's the tallest home video console.\n\nA lot of air-vents throughout making it aerodynamic, cool, quiet, and does not overheat or get hot with consecutive gameplay hours. This may change in the future if games require more performance out of the system, with similar fate like the PS4 where it was whisper quiet in beginning and became louder over the years with more graphical intensive games.\n\nHas LED lights giving it a PC look (?)\n\nFace plate easy to take out for future customization options (?).\n\n667of 820gb of free download space in console\n\nSwapping SDD is not as easy as Xbox Series X (with it's plug and play method) as you have to remove some screws. Upside is that it's standard and not a propriety SDD.\n\nPS5 is compatible with most PS4 games. If you have an external SDD from PS4 it's just plug and transfer to PS5 internal storage\n\nComes with stand. Console is not entirely flat, so stand is required for horizontal position. You have console in vertical position without stand, but does not have grip (rubber feet) so may slide if bumped into or during an earthquake\n\nFront of console: USB-C, USB-A, power, and eject button\n\nBack of console: Two USB-A (Super Speed), LAN port, HDMI, and power port\n\nWished it had more USB-C ports to be future proof, but guess they kept USB-A for some current accessories to be backwards compatible. Disappointed the PS5 official 3D pulse headset and camera uses USB-A. Also no optical audio port means i can't use some of my surround sound headsets.\n\nLoad times for PS5 games are instantaneous. Ps4 games will load much faster, even without optimized patch.\n\nPs5 have ray tracing giving games realistic lighting effects\n\n-Controller:\n\nConsole comes with one controller\n\nPhysically larger than past DuelShock controllers. Great for those with adult sized hands\n\nGreat tech demo included with 'Astro's Playroom'.\n\nHaptic feedback. Similar to Nintendo Switch HD rumble, but more apparent. Not sure if developers will implement in future their games. Even with Nintendo first party; only '1-2 Switch' and 'Mario Party' from what I recall used HD rumble at great extent and it dropped off after that.\n\nAdaptive triggers. Will feel resistance\u002Fpush back on triggers if developers implement it in game.\n\nHope both Haptic feedback and Adaptive triggers say the entire lifespan and transfer to PS6 instead of dropping off like the six axis on PS3 and light bar in PS4\n\nHas built in mic. Sound quality is similar to current smart phone on speaker. Has mute button\n\nSimilar to PS4, it has speaker and touch pad. v-p-horizontal-xxs">|</span></div><div class="disclaimer v-m-right-xxs">Posted <time class="submission-date" title="Dec 12, 2020 5:19 PM">9 months ago</time>.</div><div class="length-of-ownership">Owned for <!-- -->1 month<!-- --> when reviewed.</div></div><div class="ugc-review-body body-copy-lg"><p class="pre-white-space">An actual buyer here!!! The console has been great. No issues so far (Crosses fingers). No glitches (like many who don’t work in the tech field claim). I’ve tried plenty of PS4 games and they all work normal. I have Spiderman, 2K, COD and Valhalla and they are all good games. The adaptive triggers on the controller definitely stand out as a highlight. I turn them off for multiplayer in COD because they can be a distraction. 


I’m sure the Xbox has some benefits, but I’m sticking with Sony. Hope everyone is able to get the console they want.</p></div><div class="in-review"><div class="feature-ratings"><h4 class="features-heading">Features</h4><div class="rating-bars"><div class="Value-rating rating-group"><div class="rating-description">Value</div><div class="bars-group"><div class="sr-only">5 out of 5</div><div class="rating-bar filled first"> </div><div filled"> </div><div class="rating-bar filled"> </div><div class="rating-bar filled"> </div><div class="rating-bar filled last"> </div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div class="review-item-content col-xs-12 col-md-8 col-lg-9"><div class="d-block d-md-none"><span class="c-overlay-wrapper"><span class="overlayTrigger"><button aria-controls="f2e65480-6a41-390f-9964-ce4a95053752" aria-expanded="false" class="c-button-link author-button" data-track="Nickname Stats" type="button"><div class="ugc-author v-fw-medium body-copy-lg"><strong>JRDragon</strong></div></button></span></span></div><div class="verified-purchaser-sv-wrapper"><span class="c-overlay-wrapper"><span class="overlayTrigger"><button aria-controls="verified-purchase-badge-overlay" aria-expanded="false" class="c-button-link ugc-components verified-purchaser-badge" data-track="Verified Purchase Badge" type="button"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="svg-size-s v-m-right-xxs" role="img" viewbox="0 0 100 100"></svg>Verified Purchase</button></span></span></div><div class="network-badge-sv-mv-wrapper"></div><div class="review-heading"><div class="review-rating"><div class="c-ratings-reviews-v4 c-ratings-reviews-v4-size-small"><p class="sr-only">Rated 5 out of 5 stars</p><i aria-hidden="true" class="c-stars-wrapper c-stars-wrapper-size-eds-small"><span class="c-stars-container"><svg aria-hidden="true" fill="#C5CBD5" preserveaspectratio="xMinYMax slice" role="img" viewbox="0 0 120 24"></svg></span><span class="c-stars-container" style="width:85px"><svg aria-hidden="true" fill="#C28400" preserveaspectratio="xMinYMax slice" role="img" viewbox="0 0 120 24"></svg></span><span class="c-stars-container" style="width:85px"><svg aria-hidden="true" fill="#FFE000" preserveaspectratio="xMinYMax slice" role="img" viewbox="0 0 120 24"></svg></span></i></div></div><h4 class="c-section-title review-title heading-5 v-fw-medium" id="review-id-f2e65480-6a41-390f-9964-ce4a95053752">If you can get one, it's worth it.</h4></div><div class="review-context v-p-top-xxs"><div class="verified-purchaser-mv-wrapper"><span class="c-overlay-wrapper"><span class="overlayTrigger"><button aria-controls="verified-purchase-badge-overlay" aria-expanded="false" class="c-button-link ugc-components verified-purchaser-badge" data-track="Verified Purchase Badge" type="button"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="svg-size-s v-m-right-xxs" role="img" viewbox="0 0 100 100"></svg>Verified Purchase</button></span></span><span class="vertical-align-bottom v-p-horizontal-xxs">|</span></div><div class="disclaimer v-m-right-xxs">Posted <time class="submission-date" title="Aug 15, 2021 8:27 AM">1 month ago</time>.</div><div class="length-of-ownership">Owned for <!-- -->3 weeks<!-- --> when reviewed.</div></div><div class="ugc-review-body body-copy-lg"><p class="pre-white-space">Fimally managed to get one, and I have to say, I'm impressed. It's bigger than I expected, but it looks nice once you sit it on your TV stand. Once a gake is installed, it runs pretty quietly. The graphics are impressive. Unlike when the PS4 first came out, this controller seems to be much more sturdy. 


Finally, I really like the ability to "pause" a game, and go back to it after watching YouTube, or better yet, putting it in rest mode. After putting the game down for three days and turning the console on, I pick back up right where I started. This works for PS5 and PS4 games.


Speaking of PS4 games, the PS5 is backwards compatible with my PS4 games. So it's nice to be able to catch up and play some PS4 games I missed or want to return to. Especially with PS4 games being so scarce. 


The only concern I have is for the space. There is not a lot of space (less than the 1 TB on the box) due to the pre-inatalled apps and system data. Luckily for my PS4 games, I can use an external SSD for storing my PS4 games on. And when installing PS4 games, it'll automatically install them to my external SSD unless I tell it not to. That's a good quality of life feature. Luckily, there is an expandable storage bay in the console, so I will be looking at that in the future.


The PlayStation 5 is a great machine. The capabilities are nice, and its backwards compatibility will help with the lack of library right now due to being a new console. Even with the small library of PS5 games right now, if you can snag one, it's worth it.</p></div><div class="in-review"><div class="feature-ratings"><h4 class="features-heading">Features</h4><div class="rating-bars"><div class="Quality-rating rating-group"><div class="rating-description">Quality</div><div class="bars-group"><div class="sr-only">5 out of 5</div><div class="rating-bar filled first"> </div><div class="rating-bar filled"> </div><div class="rating-bar filled"> </div><div class="rating-bar filled"> </div><div class="rating-bar filled last"> </div></div></div><div class="Value-rating rating-group"><div class="rating-description">Value</div><div class="bars-group"><div class="sr-only">4 out of 5</div><div class="rating-bar filled first"> </div><div class="rating-bar filled"> </div><div class="rating-bar filled"> </div><div class="rating-bar filled"> </div><div class="rating-bar last"> </div></div></div><div class="EaseofUse-rating type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"http:\u002F\u002Fschema.org\u002F","@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"Product","name":"Sony - PlayStation 5 Console"},"name":"If you can get one, it's worth it.","author":{"@type":"Person","name":"JRDragon"},"reviewBody":"Fimally managed to get one, and I have to say, I'm impressed. It's bigger than I expected, but it looks nice once you sit it on your TV stand. Once a gake is installed, it runs pretty quietly. The graphics are impressive. Unlike when the PS4 first came out, this controller seems to be much more sturdy. \n\nFinally, I really like the ability to \"pause\" a game, and go back to it after watching YouTube, or better yet, putting it in rest mode. After putting the game down for three days and turning the console on, I pick back up right where I started. This works for PS5 and PS4 games.\n\nSpeaking of PS4 games, the PS5 is backwards compatible with my PS4 games. So it's nice to be able to catch up and play some PS4 games I missed or want to return to. Especially with PS4 games being so scarce. \n\nThe only concern I have is for the space. There is not a lot of space (less than the 1 TB on the box) due to the pre-inatalled apps and system data. Luckily for my PS4 games, I can use an external SSD for storing my PS4 games on. And when installing PS4 games, it'll automatically install them to my external SSD unless I tell it not to. That's a good quality of life feature. Luckily, there is an expandable storage bay in the console, so I will be looking at that in the future.\n\nThe PlayStation 5 is a great machine. The capabilities are nice, and its backwards compatibility will help with the lack of library right now due to being a new console. Even with the small library of PS5 games right now, if you can snag one, it's worth class="length-of-ownership">Owned for <!-- -->1 month<!-- --> when reviewed.</div></div><div class="ugc-review-body body-copy-lg"><p class="pre-white-space">What can I say…this is the MOST in-demand next-gen gaming console.  It’s so hard to get your hands on it that people are paying a premium above MSRP to resellers.  The picture quality is amazing on a 4K TV (recommend high refresh rate 120 MHz 4K TV if you can afford it).  It functions as a media center and allows you to watch amazon prime videos for example in addition to gaming.  It’s the console that once you play on it, you won’t want to go back to the earlier gen PS consoles.  Get it while you can!! (oftentimes you only seconds to buy before going out of stock)</p></div><div class="in-review"><div class="feature-ratings"><h4 class="features-heading">Features</h4><div class="rating-bars"><div class="review-context v-p-top-xxs"><div class="verified-purchaser-mv-wrapper"><span class="c-overlay-wrapper"><span class="overlayTrigger"><button aria-controls="verified-purchase-badge-overlay" aria-expanded="false" class="c-button-link ugc-components verified-purchaser-badge" data-track="Verified Purchase Badge" type="button"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="svg-size-s v-m-right-xxs" class="submission-date" title="Sep 3, 2021 1:42 PM">3 weeks ago</time>.</div></div><div class="ugc-review-body body-copy-lg"><p class="pre-white-space">I have owned many game consoles over the years, including all of the PlayStations, lots of Nintendo, some of the Xboxs and a lot of old generation systems as well.  I have had this system since launch day and it has been a blast so far, even the free game Astro's Playroom that is installed on the system was really fun to play.  The system is virtually silent when running (finally!) has a pretty decent line up games for having just come out.  The controller is beyond amazing, the haptic feedback and adaptive triggers definitely make the games feel more alive than in past generations.  I hope all consoles going forward have these features!  Can't wait for more PS5 only games to come out for it!</p></div><div class="in-review"><div class="feature-ratings"><h4 class="features-heading">Features</h4><div class="rating-bars"><div id="review-id-3ac48a57-5a50-3ac2-aabe-9ba8a1523fea">PlayStation 5 by Lakitu Bros.</h4></div><div class="review-context v-p-top-xxs"><div class="verified-purchaser-mv-wrapper"><span class="c-overlay-wrapper"><span class="overlayTrigger"><button aria-controls="verified-purchase-badge-overlay" aria-expanded="false" class="c-button-link ugc-components verified-purchaser-badge" class="length-of-ownership">Owned for <!-- -->2 weeks<!-- --> when reviewed.</div></div><div class="ugc-review-body body-copy-lg"><p class="pre-white-space">Welcome to the next generation. PlayStation 5 is the epitome of gaming in 2021.  Sets the new standard for future gaming with a solid state hard drive for the fastest load times and power that brings the most bang for your buck compared to a PC.  The PS5 will tingle your senses in-game using the revolutionary dual sense controller that offers adaptive triggers and haptic feedback rumblers that further immerse you into other realms of imagination. Not to mention the epic exclusive game library that can only be played on this platform. Begin a your journey into a new world with Sony PlayStation 5.</p></div><div class="in-review"><div class="feature-ratings"><h4 class="features-heading">Features</h4><div class="rating-bars"><div class="pre-white-space">Without a Doubt the Sony PS5 is the dominant standout console of this generation, it still holds its place as the alternative as of now to PC gaming. Great exclusives, and enhanced version of the predecessor PS4 games. The only issue is scarcity and how to get your hands on one. I recommend if you can purchase for retail, and hopefully there will be more consoles available for the holiday season.</p></div><div class="in-review"><div class="feature-ratings"><h4 It is probably the next best thing (only second to the console itself) with the way it works. It's not as slippery like the Dualshock and feels great in hand. Even after hours of gaming, I did not feel any fatigue in my hands. The battery life is probably similar to its predecessor. \\n\\nOverall, the console runs very smoothly and I have not experienced any sort of loudness with it. Not Perfect\",\"reviewText\":\"Coming from a PS4, I love the faster load times.  I appreciate the backwards compatibility.  I’ve got all my PS4 games stored on an external 8 terabyte usb drive, and everything loads and plays at least as well as on the built in drive on the PS4.  The new controller feels good in hand, and is a nice upgrade from the DualShock controllers.  The biggest downsides are the difficulty in finding a PS5 to actually purchase, the limited number of new titles that truly take advantage of the new console’s processing power and graphics capabilities, and the ridiculously small internal solid state drive.  PS5 games have to be played off of the internal drive, and it fills up quickly.  It helps that you can transfer games back and forth between external and internal storage, but it’s still far from ideal, and while the PS5 comes with an internal expansion bay for another, hopefully much larger, SSD, it’s not yet activated, and approved drives are not days\",\"reviewText\":\"Going over hardware and software. Not going over the every exact technical specs as you can easily look that up. Software can change overtime, this is review of software at launch. If any hardware hiccups or failures in near future I'll update this review\\n\\n--Hardware:\\n\\nPhysical:\\nLooks futuristic yet tacky. In my personal opinion, looks doesn't really matter as long it can play next gen games well\\n\\nLarge console. Standing up it's the tallest home video console.\\n\\nA lot of air-vents throughout making it aerodynamic, cool, quiet, and does not overheat or get hot with consecutive gameplay hours. This may change in the future if games require more performance out of the system, with similar fate like the PS4 where it was whisper quiet in beginning and became louder over the years with more graphical intensive games.\\n\\nHas LED lights giving it a PC look (?)\\n\\nFace plate easy to take out for future customization options (?).\\n\\n667of 820gb of free download space in console\\n\\nSwapping SDD is not as easy as Xbox Series X (with it's plug and play method) as you have to remove some screws. Upside is that it's standard and not a propriety SDD.\\n\\nPS5 is compatible with most PS4 games. If you have an external SDD from PS4 it's just plug and transfer to PS5 internal storage\\n\\nComes with stand. Console is not entirely flat, so stand is required for horizontal position. You have console in vertical position without stand, but does not have grip (rubber feet) so may slide if bumped into or during an earthquake\\n\\nFront of console: USB-C, USB-A, power, and eject button\\n\\nBack of console: Two USB-A (Super Speed), LAN port, HDMI, and power port\\n\\nWished it had more USB-C ports to be future proof, but guess they kept USB-A for some current accessories to be backwards compatible. Disappointed the PS5 official 3D pulse headset and camera uses USB-A. Also no optical audio port means i can't use some of my surround sound headsets.\\n\\nLoad times for PS5 games are instantaneous. Ps4 games will load much faster, even without optimized patch.\\n\\nPs5 have ray tracing giving games realistic lighting effects\\n\\n-Controller:\\n\\nConsole comes with one controller\\n\\nPhysically larger than past DuelShock controllers. Great for those with adult sized hands\\n\\nGreat tech demo included with 'Astro's Playroom'.\\n\\nHaptic feedback. Similar to Nintendo Switch HD rumble, but more apparent. Not sure if developers will implement in future their games. Even with Nintendo first party; only '1-2 Switch' and 'Mario Party' from what I recall used HD rumble at great extent and it dropped off after that.\\n\\nAdaptive triggers. Will feel resistance\\u002Fpush back on triggers if developers implement it in game.\\n\\nHope both Haptic feedback and Adaptive triggers say the entire lifespan and transfer to PS6 instead of dropping off like the six axis on PS3 and light bar in PS4\\n\\nHas built in mic. Sound quality is similar to current smart phone on speaker. Has mute button\\n\\nSimilar to PS4, it has speaker and touch pad. Touch pad is more sensitive this time around\\n\\nAbout double battery life of Ps4 controller. Able to get in 10 consecutive hours\\n\\nWished it came with back paddle buttons. Hopefully they release a DualSense Back Button Attachment like they did the DualShock 4\\n\\nYou can play PS4 games with DualShock 4 or DualSense . PS5 games only can be played with DualSense\\n\\n--Software\\n\\nUI, OS is the similar to PS4 with scrolling apps\\u002Fgames (left, right, up, down)\\n\\nThere's an activity row where you can track your progress on games\\n\\nOther rows are News and PSN store\\n\\nThere are notifications popups, but you can turn on 'Do Not Disturb' mode\\n\\nSimilar to phone's swipe down tool bar for basic profile (trophy list, avatar, user info,etc), accessibility options, sound, Game Base, internet wifi select, controllers (see connected controllers), etc on home screen for easy access.\\n\\n'Game Base' section is where you make party with friends and chat with them, view friend requests.\\n\\nShare button this time around will pull up menu to take snap shot, record video, or save video previously played game session for up to 60mins\\n\\nThere's an 'Your Accolades' feature where you give props to other players. Reminds me of how to give endorsements (Sportsmanship, Good Teammate, Shot Caller) in Overwatch to encourage positivity in online community. For PS5 has Helpful, Welcoming, and Good Sport\\n\\nThere are accessibility options\\u002Fpreferences you can setup that transfers to your games\\n\\nThere's a 'Switcher' option where you can change games on the fly, but unlike the Xbox Series X's 'quick resume' does not leave where you left off, and will boot you back to the home screen of that game\\n\\nPicture-in-picture mode if you want friends to help show you how to get through levels\\n\\nPS4 games load faster on PS5 if downloaded to SSD. Graphical upgrade depends on publisher if they implement a 'PS5 upgrade\\\" patch\\n\\n-For PS5 trophies.\\n\\nTrophies that have collectables there is a progress bar showing how much left to collect.\\n\\nThere are also tutorial videos for some games that implement it.\\n\\nSome trophies once selected will drop you into the level\\u002Fsection where you can obtain the trophy. Again depends on game developer if they implement it.\\n\\nPS4 trophies on PS5 act the same\\n\\nBase price for games are $70 ($10 more than last gen); Excluding Special\\u002FCollector's editions, DLC, micro-transactions, loot crates, and surprise mechanics\\n\\nOverall, aside from some odd design choices very capable next gen system. Nevertheless I was happy to receive my ps5. Overall the menu system on the ps5 is slightly different than the ps4, it will take some getting used to. However, it is better once you get the hang of it. You can also use the ps4 to play ps5 remotely which is cool. Unfortunately, because you need hdmi 2.1 to get 120hz 4k it is hard to achieve. However, 4k 60hz with raytracing is nice. The controller is pretty nifty however, I find it only fun in Astro's playroom so far. I turned off haptic feedback and the L2\\u002FR2 trigger pressure, It feels odd to play with it on. I can see it being fun in Astro's playroom and maybe a fishing game. \\n\\nOne thing to note is if you want 120hz 4k you will need a monitor with hdmi 2.1 capable of 4k 120hz plus. The choices are limited currently and the 120hz will be variable not stable 120hz so this could cause it to stutter. I would wait until mid or late next year for 120+hz 2.1 hdmi monitors. \\nYou also have to go into settings and system and prioritize for performance instead of resolution, raytracing must be tured off within the game you intend to play at 120hz. You finally have to restart the game app. I have a nice monitor that is supposed to allow 4k 144hz however, that is achieved by connecting pc to monitor using two display ports to one video card. I researched my options. I tried to install a hdmi source to display port adapter but couldn't find any that support 4k 120hz. I did find 4k 60hz adapters. If you need an adapter make sure its not unidirectional. You want hdmi source (aka ps5) to display port (monitor). Most of the adapters online will be unidirectional and only work for transferring video from a display port source (computer\\u002Flaptop) to hdmi monitor which you do not want. \\n Hard drive is a little lacking in size but is pretty quick. I transferred Modern warfare and warzone,\\nGhost of  tsushima, and cod cold war and now I'm close to 93 GB left. To be fair warzone is a huge download (about 267GB) cold war is almost 200GB of hd space. I have a few small games and Of couse the operating system itself takes up space. \\n\\nI believe as the ps5 matures it will improve and get more fun with time.\\n\\nI have to say my kids had a lot of fun playing Astro's playroom. was quite difficult to pre-order the PS5, but I truly lucked out because even with all the restocks certain retailers have had... it is still unbelievably hard to place the order. It is probably the next best thing (only second to the console itself) with the way it works. It's not as slippery like the Dualshock and feels great in hand. Even after hours of gaming, I did not feel any fatigue in my hands. The battery life is probably similar to its predecessor. \\n\\nOverall, the console runs very smoothly and I have not experienced any sort of loudness with it. I do recommend when playing games, to choose performance over the resolution. You will absolutely get a higher FPS and I think it just runs a lot better that way. \\n\\nWould highly recommend this to anyone that wants to experience next gen even though we've just merely begun to play those games.\",\"topicType\":\"review\",\"title\":\"The next gen console we've all been awaiting...\",\"secondaryRatings\":[{\"attribute\":\"Value\",\"value\":5,\"attributeLabel\":\"Value\",\"valueLabel\":\"Excellent\"},{\"attribute\":\"EaseofUse\",\"value\":5,\"attributeLabel\":\"Ease of Use\",\"valueLabel\":\"Excellent\"},{\"attribute\":\"Quality\",\"value\":5,\"attributeLabel\":\"Quality\",\"valueLabel\":\"Excellent\"}],\"submissionTime\":\"2020-11-25T23:18:13.000-06:00\",\"valueRating\":5,\"writeCommentUrl\":\"\\u002Fsite\\u002Freviews\\u002Fsubmission\\u002F6426149\\u002Freview\\u002F244273568?campaignid=PDP_&return=\"},{\"author\":\"Tdox\",\"badges\":[{\"badgeCode\":\"VerifiedPurchaser\",\"badgeDescription\":\"We’ve verified that these reviews were written by people who purchased this item at Best Buy.\",\"badgeName\":\"Verified Purchaser\",\"badgeType\":\"Custom\",\"fileName\":\"badgeContextual-verifiedPurchaser.jpg\",\"imageURL\":\"https:\\u002F\\u002Fbestbuy.ugc.bazaarvoice.com\\u002Fstatic\\u002F3545w\\u002FbadgeContextual-verifiedPurchaser.jpg\",\"iconText\":\"Verified Purchase\",\"iconPath\":\"\\u002Fugc-raas\\u002Fugc-common-assets\\u002Fugc-badge-verified-check.svg\",\"index\":100000,\"iconUrl\":\"https:\\u002F\\u002Fwww.bestbuy.com\\u002F~assets\\u002Fbby\\u002F_com\\u002Fugc-raas\\u002Fugc-common-assets\\u002Fugc-badge-verified-check.svg\"},{\"badgeCode\":\"rewardZoneNumberSilverV3\",\"badgeDescription\":\"Our Elite Plus members have spent $3,500 on eligible purchases in a calendar year. Not going over the every exact technical specs as you can easily look that up. Software can change overtime, this is review of software at launch. If any hardware hiccups or failures in near future I'll update this review\\n\\n--Hardware:\\n\\nPhysical:\\nLooks futuristic yet tacky. In my personal opinion, looks doesn't really matter as long it can play next gen games well\\n\\nLarge console. Standing up it's the tallest home video console.\\n\\nA lot of air-vents throughout making it aerodynamic, cool, quiet, and does not overheat or get hot with consecutive gameplay hours. This may change in the future if games require more performance out of the system, with similar fate like the PS4 where it was whisper quiet in beginning and became louder over the years with more graphical intensive games.\\n\\nHas LED lights giving it a PC look (?)\\n\\nFace plate easy to take out for future customization options (?).\\n\\n667of 820gb of free download space in console\\n\\nSwapping SDD is not as easy as Xbox Series X (with it's plug and play method) as you have to remove some screws. Upside is that it's standard and not a propriety SDD.\\n\\nPS5 is compatible with most PS4 games. If you have an external SDD from PS4 it's just plug and transfer to PS5 internal storage\\n\\nComes with stand. Console is not entirely flat, so stand is required for horizontal position. You have console in vertical position without stand, but does not have grip (rubber feet) so may slide if bumped into or during an earthquake\\n\\nFront of console: USB-C, USB-A, power, and eject button\\n\\nBack of console: Two USB-A (Super Speed), LAN port, HDMI, and power port\\n\\nWished it had more USB-C ports to be future proof, but guess they kept USB-A for some current accessories to be backwards compatible. Disappointed the PS5 official 3D pulse headset and camera uses USB-A. Also no optical audio port means i can't use some of my surround sound headsets.\\n\\nLoad times for PS5 games are instantaneous. Ps4 games will load much faster, even without optimized patch.\\n\\nPs5 have ray tracing giving games realistic lighting effects\\n\\n-Controller:\\n\\nConsole comes with one controller\\n\\nPhysically larger than past DuelShock controllers. Great for those with adult sized hands\\n\\nGreat tech demo included with 'Astro's Playroom'.\\n\\nHaptic feedback. Similar to Nintendo Switch HD rumble, but more apparent. Not sure if developers will implement in future their games. Even with Nintendo first party; only '1-2 Switch' and 'Mario Party' from what I recall used HD rumble at great extent and it dropped off after that.\\n\\nAdaptive triggers. Will feel resistance\\u002Fpush back on triggers if developers implement it in game.\\n\\nHope both Haptic feedback and Adaptive triggers say the entire lifespan and transfer to PS6 instead of dropping off like the six axis on PS3 and light bar in PS4\\n\\nHas built in mic. Sound quality is similar to current smart phone on speaker. Has mute button\\n\\nSimilar to PS4, it has speaker and touch pad. Touch pad is more sensitive this time around\\n\\nAbout double battery life of Ps4 controller. Able to get in 10 consecutive hours\\n\\nWished it came with back paddle buttons. Hopefully they release a DualSense Back Button Attachment like they did the DualShock 4\\n\\nYou can play PS4 games with DualShock 4 or DualSense . PS5 games only can be played with DualSense\\n\\n--Software\\n\\nUI, OS is the similar to PS4 with scrolling apps\\u002Fgames (left, right, up, down)\\n\\nThere's an activity row where you can track your progress on games\\n\\nOther rows are News and PSN store\\n\\nThere are notifications popups, but you can turn on 'Do Not Disturb' mode\\n\\nSimilar to phone's swipe down tool bar for basic profile (trophy list, avatar, user info,etc), accessibility options, sound, Game Base, internet wifi select, controllers (see connected controllers), etc on home screen for easy access.\\n\\n'Game Base' section is where you make party with friends and chat with them, view friend requests.\\n\\nShare button this time around will pull up menu to take snap shot, record video, or save video previously played game session for up to 60mins\\n\\nThere's an 'Your Accolades' feature where you give props to other players. Reminds me of how to give endorsements (Sportsmanship, Good Teammate, Shot Caller) in Overwatch to encourage positivity in online community. For PS5 has Helpful, Welcoming, and Good Sport\\n\\nThere are accessibility options\\u002Fpreferences you can setup that transfers to your games\\n\\nThere's a 'Switcher' option where you can change games on the fly, but unlike the Xbox Series X's 'quick resume' does not leave where you left off, and will boot you back to the home screen of that game\\n\\nPicture-in-picture mode if you want friends to help show you how to get through levels\\n\\nPS4 games load faster on PS5 if downloaded to SSD. Graphical upgrade depends on publisher if they implement a 'PS5 upgrade\\\" patch\\n\\n-For PS5 trophies.\\n\\nTrophies that have collectables there is a progress bar showing how much left to collect.\\n\\nThere are also tutorial videos for some games that implement it.\\n\\nSome trophies once selected will drop you into the level\\u002Fsection where you can obtain the trophy. Again depends on game developer if they implement it.\\n\\nPS4 trophies on PS5 act the same\\n\\nBase price for games are $70 ($10 more than last gen); Excluding Special\\u002FCollector's editions, DLC, micro-transactions, loot crates, and surprise mechanics\\n\\nOverall, aside from some odd design choices very capable next gen system. There are some features especially on the controller that developers have to utilize and may not be present in all games. \":null,\"qualityRating\":5,\"rating\":5,\"recommended\":true,\"text\":\"Fimally managed to get one, and I have to say, I'm impressed. It's bigger than I expected, but it looks nice once you sit it on your TV stand. Once a gake is installed, it runs pretty quietly. The graphics are impressive. Unlike when the PS4 first came out, this controller seems to be much more sturdy. \\n\\nFinally, I really like the ability to \\\"pause\\\" a game, and go back to it after watching YouTube, or better yet, putting it in rest mode. After putting the game down for three days and turning the console on, I pick back up right where I started. This works for PS5 and PS4 games.\\n\\nSpeaking of PS4 games, the PS5 is backwards compatible with my PS4 games. So it's nice to be able to catch up and play some PS4 games I missed or want to return to. Especially with PS4 games being so scarce. \\n\\nThe only concern I have is for the space. There is not a lot of space (less than the 1 TB on the box) due to the pre-inatalled apps and system data. Luckily for my PS4 games, I can use an external SSD for storing my PS4 games on. And when installing PS4 games, it'll automatically install them to my external SSD unless I tell it not to. That's a good quality of life feature. Luckily, there is an expandable storage bay in the console, so I will be looking at that in the future.\\n\\nThe PlayStation 5 is a great machine. The capabilities are nice, and its backwards compatibility will help with the lack of library right now due to being a new console. class="question-list-item"><div class="question-answer"><h4 class="question-title"><span aria-hidden="true" class="v-fw-medium">Q: </span><span class="sr-only">Question</span><a data-track="QnA: Single Question Page" href="/site/questions/sony-playstation-5-console/6426149/question/09b13f9d-0c6e-3d18-b933-28dabb82eae0" id="question-09b13f9d-0c6e-3d18-b933-28dabb82eae0">What makes them think they have the right to say you can get 120fps when it is impossible in HDMI? Only wire that can support true 120fps is a Display Port. And PS5 only has HDMI. Max frames you'll get is 60. Don't believe me? Look it up...</a></h4><p class="author"><span class="asked-ago">Asked <time class="submission-date" title="Sep 17, 2020 4:24 AM">1 year ago</time> by<!-- --> <!-- -->TheRaptor30<!-- -->.</span></p><div class="image-carousel"><div class="nav-wrapper false false page-size-eight"><ul class="image-list no-nav"><li><button class="c-button-link selected" data-track="QnA: Question: Image" type="button"><img alt="Here's proof..., click to load a larger version" src="https://photos-us.bazaarvoice.com/photo/2/cGhvdG86YmVzdGJ1eQ/4d61bc93-c6a7-5c35-8fd2-92dbd10924b1"/></button></li></ul></div></div><ul class="answers"><li class="answer"><div class="answer-text" data-answer-id="065c910d-d784-308c-8014-477ac22c5324" id="answer-065c910d-d784-308c-8014-477ac22c5324" tabindex="-1"><div class="ugc-components line-clamp"><div class="bg-fade-out"><span aria-hidden="true" class="v-fw-medium">A:</span><span class="sr-only">Answer</span> <span>LISTEN, he meant your TV not PS5. You can't edit or delete your questions on here which I think is not right, but let me state some facts...

I own a PS5 and I have made 3 YouTube videos that proves the PS5 will not go over 60fps and in some cases just over 30fps if you don't have a TV that supports HDMI 2.1

Over 90% of TV's don't have this tech, so if you think for one second you're getting the best frames and picture you better go do some more research.

I repeat: If you don't have a TV that supports 2.1 you can kiss your dreams goodbye if you think you'll get 120fps in 4K.

Only a couple TV's out there support 2.1 and I bet anything most of you don't own them. 

Here's the deal... If you have a couple thousand dollars and some cost over five thousand, then you can purchase one. Otherwise stop trying to make fun of someone just because you are unhappy with yourself.

Kind of bad knowing you own a PS5 and can't see what it can really do.....


Name calling and thinking you're better than someone only proves you have no integrity.

Now go back to playing your PS4 because a new TV and PS5 is something you can't afford..</span></div><button aria-describedby="065c910d-d784-308c-8014-477ac22c5324" class="c-button-link btn-read-more read-more-button" data-track="QnA: Answer: Read More" type="button">Read more <svg aria-hidden="true" role="img" viewbox="0 0 100 100"></svg></button></div></div><p class="author">Answered <time class="submission-date" title="Nov 16, 2020 5:15 AM">10 months ago</time> by<!-- --> <!-- -->TheTruthHurts</p><div class="vote-and-further-action"><span class="feedback-voting-reporting"><span href="/site/questions/sony-playstation-5-console/6426149/question/7651fcfd-a292-3608-9b37-1aa9da143314" id="question-7651fcfd-a292-3608-9b37-1aa9da143314">What is the difference between PS5 console for 499$ vs PS5 edition console for 399$?


Thanks</a></h4><p class="author"><span class="asked-ago">Asked <time class="submission-date" title="Sep 20, 2020 7:05 AM">1 year ago</time> by<!-- --> <!-- -->Archie<!-- -->.</span></p><ul class="answers"><li class="answer"><div class="answer-text" data-answer-id="309c058f-7901-377d-a559-3c23a2cf9663" id="answer-309c058f-7901-377d-a559-3c23a2cf9663" tabindex="-1"><div class="ugc-components line-clamp"><div class="bg-fade-out"><span aria-hidden="true" class="v-fw-medium">A:</span><span class="sr-only">Answer</span> <span>The standard PS5 ($499) can play game and movie discs in addition to downloads, while the digital one ($399) can only play downloaded titles.</span></div><button aria-describedby="309c058f-7901-377d-a559-3c23a2cf9663" class="c-button-link href="/site/questions/sony-playstation-5-console/6426149/question/5ef66f39-3c07-3962-b1fc-5b315166cfd1" id="question-5ef66f39-3c07-3962-b1fc-5b315166cfd1">When the next round ?</a></h4><p Usually a monitor will be better overall than a TV in most cases due to color gamut and latency Usually you want 5ms or less. I think you will start seeing more options in 2021 given the year we've all have had. Also don't expect 4k 120hz on ps5 to compete with a PC with latest video cards on the market. Most serious pc gamers run 1080p or 1440p with refresh rates well above 144hz. Nevertheless, it's nice to see this generation of console try to get closer to pc tech. I would think of the ps5 as a pc running a 2080 super. I will tell you my ps5 has been running cold war at a solid 4k 60 fps and has been really smooth. I have an Acer Predator XB273K Gpbmiipprzx monitor which is capable of 4k 144hz over 2 display ports on pc. It will not run over 60hz over hdmi 2.0 in my case. Hopefully next year I can upgrade to a second monitor with hdmi 2.1. Even when I do I do not expect a solid 4k 120hz experience my guess is a solid 90 fps with occasional spikes much like pc video cards. I hope with a ps5 update sometime next year they give us the ability to choose solid frame rate vs variable frame rate. I would rather lock my ps5 at 100hz (for example) than 100hz - 120hz fluctuations. Variable fps gives you the user the experience of choppy, laggy and glitchy game play. When video cards have a smoothness functionality (amd 6800xt anyone) they are talking about locking fps at a point that gives you best experience, which falls short of maximum fps but above 60 fps. Gaming at 90hz is better than jumping all around fps numbers. HDMI cables are compatible with 720p and 1080i resolutions used to transfer TNT HD programs.\\r\\n\\r\\n\\r\\nHigh Speed HDMI cables are compatible with HD 1080p and 4K UHD (3840 x 2160 pixels at 24, 25 and 30 fps) resolutions, 3D and Deep Color.\\r\\n\\r\\n\\r\\nPremium High Speed HDMI cables are compatible with HD 1080p and 4K UHD resolutions up to the maximum bitrate (60 fps as well as 24, 25 and 30 fps). They also ensure compatibility with HDR video content (HDR10, HDR10+, HLG and Dolby Vision), extended color spaces such as BT.2020 and chroma subsampling up to 4:4:4.\\r\\n\\r\\n\\r\\nUltra High Speed HDMI cables conform to the requirements of the HDMI 2.1 standard and ensure the transmission of video streams in 4K UHD (3840 x 2160 pixels), 8K60 UHD (7680 x 4320 pixels at 60 fps) and 4K120 (120 fps) non-compressed resolutions with HDR, as well as the 10K120 compressed resolution, with a certified bandwidth of 48 Gbps. Here is the thing, many games that will be released for next-gen won't be optimized for 4K @ 120fps anyway, and not many monitors or TV out there are equipped with HDMI 2.1 yet to utilize the 120hz from a console machine (TV can still display 4K @ 120Hz with its own hardware). So the general public will still play at the most 4K @ 60fps, at least for now, until more TV and monitors with HDMI 2.1 becomes more frequent. The idea for these next-gen consoles (at least for now) is to play 4K @60fps consistently this is the feature that is missing on the PS4 Pro and Xbox One X. var activeTests = document.querySelectorAll('[' + experimentAttr + ']');

var activatedTests = [];

var config1 = window.liveConfig ? (window.liveConfig && window.liveConfig.gvp && window.liveConfig.gvp.services ? window.liveConfig.gvp.services.optimizely : {}) : {};

var config2 = window.configService ? window.configService.getServiceConfig('optimizely') : {};

var placebos = (config2 && config2.get && config2.get('placebos') ? config2.get('placebos') : config1.placebos) || [];

var client,variation;

window.track = window.track || {};

var logLevelMatches = window.location.search.match(/optimizelyLoggingLevel=({d})/i);

var logLevel = logLevelMatches ? logLevelMatches[1] : 2;

var logger = {

log: function (message) {

if (isLoggingActive) {

console.log(message);

}

}

};

if (data && attrs && id) {

client = window.optimizelyClient.createInstance({

datafile: data,

skipJSONValidation: true,

logger: logger,

logLevel: logLevel

});

if (activeTests.length) {

for (var i = 0; i < activeTests.length; i++) {

activate(activeTests[i].getAttribute(experimentAttr), activeTests[i].getAttribute(evarAttr))

}

}

if (placebos.length) {

for (var i = 0; i < placebos.length; i++) {

var placebo = placebos[i];

try {

var pageType = window._do_not_use_me ? window._do_not_use_me.pageType : (window.track || {}).pageType;

if (placebo.locationHrefRegex && new RegExp(placebo.locationHrefRegex).test(window.location.href)) {

activatePlacebo(placebo)

} else if (placebo.pageTypeRegex && new RegExp(placebo.pageTypeRegex).test(pageType)) {

activatePlacebo(placebo)

}

} catch (err) {

console.log('failed to initialize placebo: ', placebo);

}

}

}

}

function activate(experimentKey, evar) {

if (activatedTests.indexOf(experimentKey) > -1) return;

var variation = client.activate(experimentKey, id, attrs);

if (evar && variation) {

window.track[evar] = experimentKey + '_Recipe_' + variation;

}

activatedTests.push(experimentKey);

return variation;

}

function activatePlacebo(placebo) {

var evar = placebo.evar;

var experimentKey = placebo.experimentKey;

if (experimentKey) {

if (activate(experimentKey, evar) && isLoggingActive) {

console.log('activated placebo');

}

}

}

var optimizelyListener = {

type: "addListener",

filter: {

type: "analytics",

name: "trackEvent"

},

handler: function(event) {

var metrics = event.data && event.data.metrics ? event.data.metrics : {};

var tags = event.data && event.data.tags ? event.data.tags : {};

var metricsTags = Object.assign({}, metrics, tags);

var eventName = event.data && event.data.name ? event.data.name.replace(/\(|\)|\s+\//g, '') : '';

if (event.data.type === 'pageview') {

eventName = 'Visit Page - ' + eventName;

}

client.track(eventName, id, attrs, metricsTags);

}

}

window.optimizely = window.optimizely || [];

window.optimizely.push(optimizelyListener);

})();

</script>

<div class="&lt;csi:vars&gt;$(csi.shop.lib-dai.v1.layoutClassList)&lt;/csi:vars&gt;" data-version="1.2.1" id="shop-lib-dai-116c94f7-3f44-4745-a687-485c509d0c6c">

<div class="shop-lib-dai"><script>

;(function daiInit() {

window._DAI_LIBS_ = window._DAI_LIBS_ || { };

window._DAI_LIBS_.tagConfig = JSON.parse('{"visualIQ":true,"visualIQConversion":true,"dynamicCreativeATC":false,"gtagPDP":true,"gtagConversion":true,"gtagPurchase":true,"gtagThankYou":true,"gtagIHC":true,"gtagATC":true,"gtagBBFB":true,"gtagAdwords":false,"gtagAppleScreenRepairTy":true,"tagIframe":true,"contentsquare":true,"contentsquareTransaction":true,"customerJournal":true,"adobe":true,"loadEnsighten":true,"checkmarx":true,"interaction":true,"adobeDcoPdp":true,"flashtalkingPurchase":true,"adobeDcoCart":true,"flashtalkingPDP":true,"flashtalkingCart":true,"flashtalkingCategoryPage":true,"opinionLabBase":true,"opinionLabSiteSearch":true,"opinionLabGlobalLink":true,"opinionLabSurveyTab":true,"opinionLabOAG":true,"opinionLabIPI":true,"opinionLabPublicEventBinding":true,"opinionLabAT":true,"impactLanding":true,"confirmIt":true,"adobeDcoPdpCategory":true,"impactConversionCS":true,"googleSearchConsole":true,"allowAllEvents":true}');

function conditionalMatch(conditions) {

var conditionalSrc;

conditions.forEach(function(condition) {

var pathMatch = (new RegExp(condition.pathRegex)).test(window.location.pathname);

var uaMatch = (new RegExp(condition.uaRegex)).test(window.navigator.userAgent);

if (pathMatch && uaMatch) {

conditionalSrc = condition.src;

}

})

return conditionalSrc;

}

var daiScript = document.createElement('script');

daiScript.async = true;

if (document.cookie.match(/(^| )dai_local=([^;]+)/)) {

var localHash = document.cookie.match(/(^| )dai_local=([^;]+)/)[2];

daiScript.dataset.refId = "lib-dai-local";

daiScript.src = 'https://www.bestbuy.com/~assets/bby/_com/analytics-dotcom/analyticsInit-'+localHash+'.js';

} else {

var _conditions = JSON.parse('[]');

var _conditionalSrc = conditionalMatch(_conditions);

var _original = 'https://www.bestbuy.com/~assets/bby/_com/analytics-dotcom/analyticsInit-9fe1446d306420c99ce1fd7cec2a29d9.js';

daiScript.dataset.refId = "lib-dai";

daiScript.src = _conditionalSrc || _original;

}

var _container = document.getElementsByClassName('shop-lib-dai')[0] || document.body;

_container.append(daiScript);

})();

</script><script async="" src="https://www.bestbuy.com/~assets/bby/_com/@ds/unified-chat/dist/javascript/unified-chat-init-7502b79c.js"></script></div>
